1136.name: Urban Vegetable Garden
1136.description: This sourcemap serves to visually illustrate how a vegetable garden became established on an empty lot in Brooklyn and explore it's effect on the carbon footprint of our diets.

parts.description:
We bought our garden supplies from Saifee Garden Store. Supplies include: 
Two shovels
Three hardhats
100 dehydrated soil disks
Two planting trays
One growing light
One wire cutter
One pH meter
parts.name: Garden Supplies

parts.description: We were given access to a faucet by a local mechanic who's shop was only a few feet away. We filled buckets when we had to water the garden but mostly the rain worked as our chief water supplier.
parts.name: Water

parts.description: This line represents the total distance our crops would have to travel before we could consume them. Traveling by bicycle, it would be a short distance of less than two miles. Compare that with a broccoli purchased from Key Foods. (Part 7)
parts.name: Exported Crops (Theoretical Data)
